chatgpt_double_star.new_statement: A durable middle path is to keep state-run elections and the constitutional role of states, but make the winner reflect the broadest voter support and reduce winner-take-all distortions. States could adopt proportional allocation of electors (or a ranked-choice statewide tally) with a uniform national baseline for ballot access, auditing, recount triggers, and certification timelines so close results are handled consistently. Reforms should be phased in and designed to expand campaigning beyond a few swing states, so voters in rural, suburban, and urban communities can trust that their votes matter and the rules won’t shift for partisan advantage.

chatgpt_double_star_rankings.new_statement: Reform should make presidential outcomes track the national popular will more closely while keeping states meaningfully involved so rural and small-state communities don’t feel written off. A practical bridge is the National Popular Vote Interstate Compact and/or proportional allocation of electors, paired with clear nationwide standards for ballot access, audits, recount triggers, and certification deadlines so every lawful vote is counted consistently. Adding ranked-choice voting where feasible can encourage coalition-building and reduce winner-take-all distortions. Any changes should be phased in and bipartisan, emphasizing transparency and legitimacy so people across regions can trust and accept close results.

chatgpt_double_star_personas.new_statement: A durable reform should make the presidential outcome track the national popular will more closely while keeping states and smaller communities meaningfully involved, so people in big cities, small towns, and rural areas all feel their votes matter. A practical bridge is the National Popular Vote Interstate Compact or proportional allocation of electors, paired with clear nationwide standards for ballot access, counting, audits, and recounts so every lawful vote is handled consistently and transparently. Any changes should be phased in and bipartisan, with safeguards against last‑minute rule changes and with election administration that is secure, accessible, and easy to understand.
